title: Tier-two nations' farmers and bank clerks deserve better funding and fixtures after strong World Cup performances
text:
Deep inside the Tokyo Stadium, Janry du Toit could not stop smiling on Sunday. For 35 minutes, Namibia’s assorted farmers, dentists and bank clerks had proved themselves the equals of the All Blacks and were trailing 10-9.

Even if the reigning champions pulled away to complete a 71-9 victory, it could not deflate the pride that was threatening to burst out of the Namibians’ chests. For utility back Du Toit, it was sweet vindication of his decision to quit his job as a teacher in the build-up to the tournament. “Definitely, the sacrifice is worth it,” Du Toit said. “Since I was young,...
description: Deep inside the Tokyo Stadium, Janry du Toit could not stop smiling on Sunday.
